result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel V. Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

#17R 5066, e-Payment
JFFO, NEJ, NOC mailed to last known address
Atty Abernethy-Mays was counsel of record, no motion to withdrawal filed, JOCR no atty present but showed up on JOC.

Court calls  @  3:44 pm. Defendant Manuel V. Hoffman in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Courtney Imig, intern Def. waives attorney rights.  Court is satisfied and waives def. right to have an attorney.  State has reviewed revocation and summary packet no corrections.  Def. hasn't reviewed revocation and summary packet and no corrections. Def. would like to finish case today, however, did review revocation packet in Marathon Co. case. State is ready to proceed and gives recommendation, 2 years i.c. 3 years e.s. 389 credit.  Concurrent to Marathon Co. case. Def. makes statement.  Court orders on ct 1 5 years prison, 2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision, Credit 389 days, Concurrent with any other sentence currently serving. Court obligation converted to civil judgment.  Def. advised of postconviction rights. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. Def. questions court obligations. Def. is eligible for Challenge and Substance program.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 3, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Manuel V. Hoffman in court, in custody and via-video from Dodge Correctional Inst.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. off the record.  Def. advised of attorney rights. Def. will represent himself. JA will mail out notice of court date and SAR packet.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for October 3, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 10, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Court calls  @ 4:10 pm. Defendant Manuel V. Hoffman in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State heard on sentencing revocation packet got yesterday.  Def. didn't see revocation packet from Langlade Co. only Marathon Co. Def. makes statement.  Court feels def. needs an attorney. Def. is good if everything is concurrent time.  State is not bound to DOC recommendation.  State request adjournment. Court will grant adjournment.
ad prosequendum and order to institution
Revocation Packet summary
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 20, 2017 at 10:15 am.
#15R 4654, e-Payment
ad prosequendum and order to institution (Copy)

Defendant Manuel V. Hoffman in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Manuel V. Hoffman in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:05 a.m. Agreement stated - State has complied with victim notification requirements. Def will plead to ct 1, dismiss and read in ct 2, withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation concurrent to all others, $40 restitution, counseling, court costs. Atty Abernethy-Mays and Def agree. Court reviews plea quest. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 dismissed and read in based on agreement. Constitutional rights, elements reviewed. Atty Abernethy-Mays satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of forgery-uttering. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Nothing by Def. Sentencing remarks by the Court, will adopt agreement. Withheld prison sentence, 3 yrs probation, concurrent to sentence currently serving, counseling as required, court costs, restitution $40. No credit for time served if revoked. Def advised of voting and firearms restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. DNA sample if needed but no surcharge.
ad prosequendum and order to institution

Defendant Manuel V. Hoffman in court & in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 1:41 pm. Daniel Duley, Invg for City of Antigo Police Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies. Atty Abernethy-Mays gives argument & moves to dismiss. State replys. Court finds probable cause & binds over.  Information Filed.  Atty Abernethy-Mays has copy of information, waives reading, & enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty plea on ct's 1 & 2.  Court adjourns.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm. Court recalls @ 1:50 pm. Court vacates warrant.  State heard on bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 Signature bond.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution

Defendant Manuel V. Hoffman in court by phone from Kettle Moraine with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Preliminary hearing to be set.  DA will prepare a writ.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
